summary: Harvard University, located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, is one of the most prestigious and selective private universities in the world. With an acceptance rate of approximately 3.65%, admission is highly competitive. For the 2025-2026 academic year, the annual tuition is $57,328, with a total estimated cost of attendance of $89,238. Harvard is also known for its robust financial aid, offering free tuition to families with an income of up to $200,000. Among its many distinguished programs, the most popular include Economics, Computer Science, Government, and Biology.

undergraduate.gpa_requirement: Highly competitive; most admitted students 3.9-4.0 unweighted GPA
undergraduate.essays_required: Yes, Common App essay and multiple Harvard-specific writing supplements
undergraduate.letters_of_recommendation: Two teacher recommendations and one counselor recommendation required

costs.financial_aid_available: Yes. For 2025-26, tuition is free for families earning up to $200,000; all costs covered for families under $100,000; robust need-based aid for all

required_courses: Four years of science (including biology, chemistry, and physics)
Four years of a single foreign language
recommended_courses: Advanced courses in mathematics and science
Additional coursework in social sciences and humanities
admission_requirements.extracurricular_importance: Extremely important; strong leadership, talent, and sustained commitment are highly valued

student_life.housing_guarantee: Guaranteed for all four undergraduate years
student_life.dining_options: 12 residential dining halls plus specialty caf√©s and campus eateries
student_life.study_abroad_programs: Extensive options through Harvard College and partner institutions

special_features: Tuition-free for families earning up to $200,000 (from 2025-26 onwards)
Global network of alumni and resources
